name: Mercure Hotel Frankfurt Airport Dreieich

reviews.text: I recently stayed two nights at the Mercure Hotel in Dreieich which was booked by the local office I was visiting on business. This review will be short due to the bout of nasty food poisoning during my stay in Dreieich so I was laid up in my room for part of my visit. Mercure is very convenient to the airport and office and is close to a local train station. I was able to get a taxi very easily to get to/from the office/airport and the front desk staff were helpful. There was a little store a short walk from the hotel. Dreieich seemed to be a very attractive town and the neighborhood around the hotel appeared to be safe. The room was clean but sparsely decorated and somewhat dated. There was not any central AC system so I had to open my door/window to a patio to get some fresh air….however it was somewhat noisy and smoky since my room faced the back of the hotel where the workers hung out and smoked and truck delivery area. Recommend you ask for a room not in the back. The room had two twin beds but I was able to push them together. There was no iron in the room however there was a hotel service if you drop off by 9am nor was there a tea/coffee maker in the room. (I prefer to make my own coffee in the morning) The minibar came in handy with ample supply of water and juice and alcohol. I was not impressed by the prepared breakfast selections…eggs and meat were over cooked. The wireless internet was very expensive at 24 Euro for 24 hours and didn’t work part of the time. Then I later found free internet down in the lobby. Overall, it wasn’t terrible hotel but not like the typical business accommodations I’m use to in the States. Also, I was female traveling alone on business and knew very little German (a few words) and it seemed to be a safe place to stay....I’m hoping my next trip to Dreieich will be illness free so I can explore Frankfurt and Dreieich a little more.
reviews.title: Business Visit to Dreieich

reviews.text: Modern 90-bed hotel building set back from the road, with large car park in front. Rooms clean and efficient, if a little on the small side, but thats OK as you only want to sleep there anyway.

reviews.text: Beware the picture on the website is misleading, I assume this is the "annexe", the real main hotel is at the back of the car park to the side of the "Guest House" building in the picture.

description: A quiet 4 star hotel offering 92 comfortable rooms. Situated on the outskirts of the city, the Mercure Frankfurt Airport Dreieich is located between Frankfurt, Darmstadt and Offenbach, is close to Frankfurt International airport and 15 kilometers far from the famousTrade fair center. The hotel features conference rooms for up to 80 persons, a restaurant, a bar lounge, a sauna and a solarium.
